Committee of the Cooperative Studies, Korean Society of Nephrology
results.text_hl: Food and Drug Administration (FDA) revised @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@'s indication for use in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Renal_Insufficiency_Chronic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D051436 @@@CKD@@@ stage 3, whereas the indications for @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ use set by the Korean Ministry of Food and Drug Safety remain unchanged.

results.title: Assessment of Metformin Intolerance: A Retrospective Chart Review.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ non-users were found to have significantly lower mean BMI (30.87 vs. 35.43; p-value <0.0001), and significantly higher rates of @<m>DISEASE_Renal_Insufficiency_Chronic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D051436 @@@CKD@@@ (25.93% vs 14.73%; p-value <0.0001) as compared to @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ users.

citations.NLM: Murphy PZ, Bramwell-Shittu A, Boehmer K, Painter J, Mahashabde R. Assessment of Metformin Intolerance: A Retrospective Chart Review. Innov Pharm. 2024;15(3):. PMID: 39483503

results.title: Metformin versus SGLT-2 inhibitors: how low can we go?
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ and sodium-glucose cotransporter 2 inhibitors show promise, but clinical trials with a head-to-head comparison in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with more advanced (stage 3b-4) @<m>DISEASE_Renal_Insufficiency_Chronic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D051436 @@@chronic kidney disease@@@ are largely lacking, partly for safety reasons.

citations.NLM: Pruijm M, Phan O, Zanchi A. Metformin versus SGLT-2 inhibitors: how low can we go? Kidney Int. 2022 May;101(5):874-877. PMID: 35461613
